description.narrative:
Cambodian Volunteers for Society (CVS) is implementing the project called #Promoting Youth Engagement in Mekong Water Governance.# The project aims at Strengthening the vibrancy of Cambodian young women and men activists in their collaboration with ASEANto promote youth participation in Mekong water governance decision making process. The project will focus on increasing youth voices in the discussion of planned Sambor hydropower dam in Sambor district, Kratie province and other planned dams in the Mekong Mainstream. Overall Objective (Goal): Increased youths# engagement in Mekong water governance decision making process. Specific Objective: Increasedyouth participation to discuss and debate in water resource governance dialogues. To achieve the project aim, CVS identified 3 mainoutcomes: Outcome 1: Increased youths# awareness and capacity on water governance; Outcome 2: Strengthened youth network and information sharing among youth and the public; and Outcome 3: Increased National and regional active participation of young women and men(university and community) to voice their concerns about water resource governance and alternative energy.
The project engages University youths from various Universities both in Phnom Penh and provinces, and youth from Kratie and Stung Treng provinces where theplanned hydropower projects exist as direct beneficiaries. The project raises awareness to youth men and women on the positive and negative impacts of Mekong Hydropower dams in Laos and Sambo Hydropower dam in Cambodia and mobilize their participation to voices their concerns through discussions and campaigns to send key messages to decision-makers at Cambodia national level during Cambodian Youth Forum (CYF), Consultation, meetings, workshops, dialogues,forums and ASEAN regional level during the ASEAN Youth Forum (AYF) and ASEAN Civil Society Conference/ASEAN People Forum (ACSC/APF) 2017 in The Philippines. In addition, youth recommendations from theworkshop and the forum will also be included in the document in order to influence decision makers not to see large hydropower dam as good sources for energy or replace with other alternatives. This project will bring the linkage from the national to regional platform which will provide opportunity for young people to influence policy makers at the national and ASEAN regional levels about theimportance of youth participation in discussion of hydropower dam development projects on the Mekong River.

participating-org.narrative: Cambodian Volunteers for Society (CVS) is a non-profit and non-political organization established in 2005 by several entities, including the Royal University of Phnom Penh, Department of Environmental Science (DES), Fisheries Action Coalition Team (FACT), Urban Poor Development Funds (UPDF) and Thai Volunteers Services (TVS). CVS officially registered at Ministry of Interior on October 30th,2009. The organization#s founders are now members of its Board of Directors. CVS envisions a peaceful and democratic society, governed well and driven by its vibrant youth. The organizational goal of CVS is to #empower youth as agents participating in civil society and good governance through capacity building of organized youth groups by providing training enabling them to improve the knowledge and skills needed to advocate for the protection of their rights, and community natural resources, in order to secure their livelihoods.# CVS believes in social justice to bring peace, equity and protection of youth rights;transparency and free of corruption give equal opportunities for youth to participate in social development; democracy promotes freedom of expression and respects of youth rights; youth has ownership over development process in their communities and learning from real life experiences improves youth#s capacity in addressing youth#s needs and interest.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
